column1: Pedro Duque Duque (born 14 March 1963) is a Spanish astronaut and a veteran of two space missions.
Duque earned a degree in Aeronautical Engineering from the Universidad Politcnica de Madrid (UPM) in 1986.
He worked for GMV and for the European Space Agency (ESA) for six years before being selected as an astronaut candidate in 1992.
Duque underwent training in both Russia and the United States.
His first spaceflight was as a mission specialist aboard space shuttle mission STS-95, during which Duque supervised ESA experimental modules.
In October 2003, Duque visited the International Space Station for several days during a crew changeover.

column2: The scientific program of this visit was called by ESA/Spain Misin Cervantes.

column1: He worked at the UPM, in the Escuela Tcnica Superior de Ingenieros Aeronuticos, he used to work at Deimos Imaging.
Currently he is back as an astronaut of ESA, and leads the Flight Operations Office near Munich.
